intro: Cryptandra westringiifolia, commonly known as the Westring's cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It features small, elliptical leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Cryptandra westringiifolia is a shrub that plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
